title: Maze Runner
detail: You have successfully navigated the maze! Here are some fun facts about mazes and labyrinths.
facts: The oldest known labyrinth was built in ancient Egypt around 4,500 years ago.
The word 'maze' comes from the Old English word 'm√¶s', which means 'delusion' or 'confusion'.
The most famous maze in Greek mythology is the Labyrinth of Crete, which was said to house the Minotaur.
Hedge mazes became popular in Europe during the Renaissance and are still a popular attraction in many gardens today.
The world's largest maze is the Pineapple Garden Maze in Hawaii, which covers over 3 acres of land.
